headline: Stitching ‘1917’ Into a Seamless Quilt
abstract: The cinematographer Roger Deakins didn’t know the plan was to make it look like a real-time story until he received the script: “That was a bit of a shock.”
lead_paragraph: Roger Deakins received his first Oscar nomination for best cinematography 25 years ago, for “The Shawshank Redemption.” He would earn 13 more before he finally won in 2018 for “Blade Runner 2049.” This year, he’s in the running again for his bravura work on the World War I drama “1917.”
